name: Clin T Melanoma Sinus Ethmoid
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:**  TNM does not include an in situ category for mucosal melanoma tumors. Assign 88 and behavior code /2 for in situ tumors.

**Note 2:**  Mucosal melanomas are aggressive tumors, therefore T1 and T2 are omitted as are Stages I and II.

**Note 3:**  Assign T3 for localized tumor when no other information is available or for extension involving the mucosa only of adjacent sites.

**Note 4:**  Assign T4a or T4b for extension involving the deeper tissues of the primary or adjacent sites.
footnotes: *T4 is not defined by UICC in the 7th edition. Approval has been provided by UICC to use "Tumor invades bone, nerve or extrinsic deep muscles" as T4.
rows:
Clinical evaluation performed but unknown results or extension not stated
Clinical evaluation performed but results not documented in patient record
Tumor limited to the epithelium and/or submucosa (mucosal disease)

Tumor confined to mucosa of left, right or both ethmoid sinus(es)

Confined to mucosa of ethmoid sinus, NOS

Extension involving mucosa only of nasal cavity including:
    Floor
    Lateral wall
    Nasal vestibule
    Nasal cavity, NOS
    Septum
    Turbinates

Extension to mucosa only of adjacent structures: 
    Frontal sinus
    Maxillary sinus
    Nasopharynx
    Sphenoid sinus

Localized, NOS

Stated as T3

Note: T4 has subcategories of T4a and T4b. Assign T4 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Tumor invades bone, nerve or extrinsic deep muscles

Stated as T4[NOS]

Tumor invades: 
     Deep soft tissue
     Cartilage
     Bone
     Overlying skin

Extension to deep soft tissue of left, right, or both ethmoid sinus(es)
Soft tissue NOS
Extension to deep soft tissue of left or right ethmoid sinus or ethmoid sinus, NOS with mucosal involvement of structures in T3
Invasive tumor confined to either left, right, or both ethmoid sinus(es) with bony invasion 
(Involvement of perpendicular plate of ethmoid bone or ethmoid air cells)

Extension to deep tissues of adjacent  structures with or without bony invasion:
    Anterior orbital contents
    Frontal sinus
    Hard palate
    Maxillary sinus
    Medial wall or floor of orbit
    Nasopharynx
    Orbital plate
    Pterygoid plates

Stated as T4a

Tumor invades any of the following:
    Brain
    Dura
    Skull base
    Lower cranial nerves (IX, X, XI, XII)
    Masticator space
    Carotid artery
    Prevertebral space
    Mediastinal structures

Anterior cranial fossa 
Base of skull
Clivus

Middle cranial fossa

Further contiguous extension :

Stated as T4b
In situ case but no pTis is defined by TNM
